pullRequest.body:
This file contains the spectral theorem for Hermitian matrices and nearby relevant theorems. We rewrote the file, recasting the natural eigenvector basis matrix as a unitary called `eigenvectorUnitary`, and removed a lot of defeq abuse that the original file contained, considerably simplifying things.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #12244

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

wrote:

> ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.

> First round of comments

> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/PosDef.lean

> +  let C := hA.1.eigenvectorUnitary.1
>    let E := diagonal ((‚Üë) ‚àò Real.sqrt ‚àò hA.1.eigenvalues : n ‚Üí ùïú)
>    suffices C * (E * (C·¥¥ * C) * E) * C·¥¥ = A by
>      rw [Matrix.PosSemidef.sqrt, pow_two]
>      change (C * E * C·¥¥) * (C * E * C·¥¥) = A
>      simpa only [‚Üê mul_assoc] using this
>    have : C·¥¥ * C = 1 := by
>
> You can get rid of this have entirely now.
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/PosDef.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11363#discussion_r1578584085>

> +  let C := hA.1.eigenvectorUnitary.1
>    let E := diagonal ((‚Üë) ‚àò Real.sqrt ‚àò hA.1.eigenvalues : n ‚Üí ùïú)
>    suffices C * (E * (C·¥¥ * C) * E) * C·¥¥ = A by
>
> This should work better with it being unitary
> ‚¨áÔ∏è Suggested change
>
> -  suffices C * (E * (C·¥¥ * C) * E) * C·¥¥ = A by
> +  suffices C * (E * (star C * C) * E) * star C = A by
>
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/PosDef.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11363#discussion_r1578584268>
> :

```suggestion
  suffices C * (E * (star C * C) * E) * star C = A by

```

```suggestion
  exact hM.isHermitian.eigenvalues_pos i
```

we indent by increments of *2* additional spaces
```suggestion
      = diagonal (RCLike.ofReal ‚àò hA.eigenvalues) := by
```

```suggestion
  EuclideanSpace.basisFun_apply, WithLp.equiv_single, ‚Üê mulVec_mulVec,
  eigenvectorUnitary_mulVec, ‚Üê mulVec_mulVec, mulVec_eigenvectorBasis,
  Matrix.diagonal_mulVec_single, mulVec_smul, star_eigenvectorUnitary_mulVec,
  RCLike.real_smul_eq_coe_smul (K := ùïú), WithLp.equiv_symm_smul, WithLp.equiv_symm_single,
  Function.comp_apply, mul_one, WithLp.equiv_symm_single]
```

```suggestion
      * (star (eigenvectorUnitary hA : Matrix n n ùïú)) := by
  rw [‚Üê spectral_theorem1, mul_assoc, mul_assoc,
    (Matrix.mem_unitaryGroup_iff).mp (eigenvectorUnitary hA).2, mul_one,
    ‚Üê mul_assoc, (Matrix.mem_unitaryGroup_iff).mp (eigenvectorUnitary hA).2, one_mul]
```

The `1`, `2`, `3` naming is really not great.

Maybe they could be (in this order)

1. `star_mul_self_mul_eq_diagonal` or `spectral_theorem_eq_diagonal`
2. `eq_mul_diagonal_star_mul` or `spectral_theorem`
3. Do we even need this one? It follows from either of the other two plus a `simp`.
Omitted the third one.

this should work
```suggestion
```
Are you suggesting removing this rw? If so, I tried this and it doesn't compile.

```suggestion
    congr! with v
```

This should already be in Mathlib 
```suggestion
```
Maybe `piLp_equiv_toEuclideanLin`? I'll try to see if I can use this, but it looks slightly different because of the `toLin` parts. It doesn't directly do a `mulVec`.
Ah! That worked for the next theorem, I think. Let me keep going with it.

It breaks the proof of `star_mul_self_mul_eq_diagonal` below at the final line. That proof is very specific, though. Maybe it's good to do what you do and try to get the elaborator to fill in more...for robustness. Let me see if I can repair the proof.
Not pushing changes yet.
Yeah, I'm not so sure about this. I'll ping you on Zulip...

```suggestion
  simpa only [eigenvectorBasis, OrthonormalBasis.reindex_apply, toEuclideanLin_apply,
    RCLike.real_smul_eq_coe_smul (K := ùïú)] using
      congr(‚áë$((isHermitian_iff_isSymmetric.1 hA).apply_eigenvectorBasis
        finrank_euclideanSpace ((Fintype.equivOfCardEq (Fintype.card_fin _)).symm j)))
```

You can use dot notation to shorten this a bit. 
```suggestion
  simp only [mulVec_eigenvectorBasis, dotProduct_smul,‚Üê EuclideanSpace.inner_eq_star_dotProduct,
    inner_self_eq_norm_sq_to_K, RCLike.smul_re, hA.eigenvectorBasis.orthonormal.1 i,
    mul_one, algebraMap.coe_one, one_pow, RCLike.one_re]
```

Maybe the last `eigenvectorBasis` doesn't fit. I didn't check. Dot notation again.
```suggestion
  ‚ü®(EuclideanSpace.basisFun n ùïú).toBasis.toMatrix (hA.eigenvectorBasis).toBasis,
    (EuclideanSpace.basisFun n ùïú).toMatrix_orthonormalBasis_mem_unitary (eigenvectorBasis hA)‚ü©
```

```suggestion
  apply Matrix.toEuclideanLin.injective
  apply Basis.ext (EuclideanSpace.basisFun n ùïú).toBasis
  intro i
  simp only [toEuclideanLin_apply, OrthonormalBasis.coe_toBasis, EuclideanSpace.basisFun_apply,
    WithLp.equiv_single, ‚Üê mulVec_mulVec, eigenvectorUnitary_mulVec, ‚Üê mulVec_mulVec,
    mulVec_eigenvectorBasis, Matrix.diagonal_mulVec_single, mulVec_smul,
    star_eigenvectorUnitary_mulVec, RCLike.real_smul_eq_coe_smul (K := ùïú), WithLp.equiv_symm_smul,
    WithLp.equiv_symm_single, Function.comp_apply, mul_one, WithLp.equiv_symm_single]
  apply PiLp.ext
  intro j
  simp only [PiLp.smul_apply, EuclideanSpace.single_apply, smul_eq_mul, mul_ite, mul_one, mul_zero]
```
Was this just spacing? It seems like I improperly indented again...

I think for elements of `unitaryGroup` we should prefer this spelling over `Matrix.conjTranspose`.
```suggestion
  (star hA.1.eigenvectorUnitary : Matrix n n ùïú)
```

All the `#align` statements got clobbered in this refactor. Can you go through the diff, find the ones that are still relevant, and update them? If some things really did get deleted you can use `#noalign`. For an example of each:
```lean
#align matrix.is_hermitian.eigenvector_matrix Matrix.IsHermitian.eigenvectorUnitary
#noalign matrix.is_hermitian.eigenvector_matrix_inv
```

The `#align` statements should go right after the corresponding declaration. The `#noalign`s can be grouped together somewhere (e.g., at the bottom of the file). Please add a comment to them explaining why they all disappeared.
These should now be done.
Can you put this `#align` back now?
Yes. I didn't fix all of the #align for PosDef...I should go do that...
Ok. I think the one you mentioned was the only one. So done...

There was no such Lean 3 declaration
```suggestion
```
Oh, right!!!
Can you update this docstring to be more like the one above? Especially since this is the thing we're calling `spectral_theorem`

This corresponds to the old primed version
```suggestion
#align matrix.is_hermitian.spectral_theorem' Matrix.IsHermitian.spectral_theorem
```

this can be removed with the `simp` change suggested below.
```suggestion
```

ditto.
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  simp [-isUnit_iff_ne_zero, -unitary.coe_star, rank_diagonal]
```

```suggestion
#noalign matrix.is_hermitian.conj_transpose_eigenvector_matrix
#noalign matrix.is_hermitian.spectral_theorem
```

```suggestion
/-- Unitary matrix whose columns are `Matrix.IsHermitian.eigenvectorBasis`. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: new definition of `eigenvectorUnitary`

nodes.body: First round of comments

Thanks! Will go through these ASAP.

On Wed, Apr 24, 2024, 6:28 PM Jireh Loreaux ***@***.***>
wrote:

> ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
>
> First round of comments
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/PosDef.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11363#discussion_r1578583691>
> :
>
> > @@ -162,23 +163,22 @@ lemma posSemidef_sqrt : PosSemidef hA.sqrt := by
>

>  lemma sq_sqrt : hA.sqrt ^ 2 = A := by
> -  let C := hA.1.eigenvectorMatrix
> +  let C := hA.1.eigenvectorUnitary.1
>    let E := diagonal ((‚Üë) ‚àò Real.sqrt ‚àò hA.1.eigenvalues : n ‚Üí ùïú)
>    suffices C * (E * (C·¥¥ * C) * E) * C·¥¥ = A by
>      rw [Matrix.PosSemidef.sqrt, pow_two]
>      change (C * E * C·¥¥) * (C * E * C·¥¥) = A
>      simpa only [‚Üê mul_assoc] using this
>    have : C·¥¥ * C = 1 := by
>
> You can get rid of this have entirely now.
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/PosDef.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11363#discussion_r1578584085>
> :
>
> > @@ -162,23 +163,22 @@ lemma posSemidef_sqrt : PosSemidef hA.sqrt := by
>
>  @[simp]
>  lemma sq_sqrt : hA.sqrt ^ 2 = A := by
> -  let C := hA.1.eigenvectorMatrix
> +  let C := hA.1.eigenvectorUnitary.1
>    let E := diagonal ((‚Üë) ‚àò Real.sqrt ‚àò hA.1.eigenvalues : n ‚Üí ùïú)
>    suffices C * (E * (C·¥¥ * C) * E) * C·¥¥ = A by
>
> This should work better with it being unitary
> ‚¨áÔ∏è Suggested change
>
> -  suffices C * (E * (C·¥¥ * C) * E) * C·¥¥ = A by
> +  suffices C * (E * (star C * C) * E) * star C = A by
>
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/PosDef.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11363#discussion_r1578584268>
> :
>

>  lemma sq_sqrt : hA.sqrt ^ 2 = A := by

> +  let C := hA.1.eigenvectorUnitary.1
>

> +  let C : Matrix n n ùïú := hA.1.eigenvectorUnitary

> :
>
> >    rw [this, mul_one]
>    have : E * E = diagonal ((‚Üë) ‚àò hA.1.eigenvalues) := by
>      rw [diagonal_mul_diagonal]
>      refine congr_arg _ (funext fun v ‚Ü¶ ?_) -- why doesn't "congr with v" work?
>      simp [‚Üê pow_two, ‚Üê RCLike.ofReal_pow, Real.sq_sqrt (hA.eigenvalues_nonneg v)]
>    rw [this]
> -  convert hA.1.spectral_theorem'.symm
> -  apply Matrix.IsHermitian.conjTranspose_eigenvectorMatrix
> +  convert hA.1.spectral_theorem2.symm
>
> I would get rid of the rw [this, mul_one] and rw [this] above and just go
> with
> ‚¨áÔ∏è Suggested change
>
> -  convert hA.1.spectral_theorem2.symm
> +  simpa [this] using hA.1.spectral_theorem2.symm

> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/PosDef.lean

> +    (by simpa [RCLike.ofReal_nonneg] using h)).mul_mul_conjTranspose_same _
>

> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/PosDef.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11363#discussion_r1578586994>
> :
>

> :
>
> > ***@***.***
> +theorem rank_mul_units (A : (Matrix n n ùïú)À£) (B : Matrix n n ùïú) :
>
> Please indicate that these lemmas are waiting on #12244
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12244>
> ------------------------------
>

> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11363#discussion_r1578588007>
> :
>

> -    inv_eq_left_inv hA.eigenvectorMatrix_mul_inv, ‚Üê conjTranspose_eigenvectorMatrix, mul_mul_apply]

> +     = diagonal (RCLike.ofReal ‚àò hA.eigenvalues) := by
>
> we indent by increments of *2* additional spaces
> ‚¨áÔ∏è Suggested change

> :

> +    (Matrix.mem_unitaryGroup_iff).mp (eigenvectorUnitary hA).2, mul_one,

> -  rw [‚Üê @Matrix.mul_inv_eq_iff_eq_mul_of_invertible (A := hA.eigenvectorMatrixInv)] at this
> -  have := congr_arg RCLike.re (congr_fun (congr_fun this i) i)
> -  rw [diagonal_apply_eq, Function.comp_apply, RCLike.ofReal_re,
> -    inv_eq_left_inv hA.eigenvectorMatrix_mul_inv, ‚Üê conjTranspose_eigenvectorMatrix, mul_mul_apply]
> -    at this

> -#align matrix.is_hermitian.eigenvalues_eq Matrix.IsHermitian.eigenvalues_eq

> +theorem spectral_theorem1 :
>
> The 1, 2, 3 naming is really not great.
>
> Maybe they could be (in this order)

>    2. eq_mul_diagonal_star_mul or spectral_theorem
>    3. Do we even need this one? It follows from either of the other two
>    plus a simp.
